intro: Biscutella laevigata subsp. woycickii, commonly known as the smooth biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered with a fine layer of pubescence. The flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in racemes, contributing to its ornamental value in native plant gardens.
